title: Opening Scene Magic
fact: The opening musical number "Another Day of Sun" was filmed in just two days on a closed highway with over 100 dancers.
behindTheScenes: Director Damien Chazelle insisted on filming this in one continuous take style, though it was actually multiple shots cleverly edited together.

title: Live Singing
fact: Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone sang all their songs live on set, unlike most movie musicals which are pre-recorded.
behindTheScenes: This required Gosling to learn piano for 3 months and Stone to take multiple singing lessons to prepare for their roles.

title: Oscar Record
fact: La La Land was mistakenly announced as Best Picture winner instead of Moonlight in one of Oscar's most memorable moments.
behindTheScenes: The envelope mix-up lasted nearly two minutes before being corrected, creating television history and viral memes.

title: Griffith Observatory
fact: The magical dance sequence at the observatory was filmed on a green screen with the actors suspended by wires.
behindTheScenes: The planetarium scene took 3 days to film and required extensive choreography to create the weightless, dreamlike effect.

title: Almost Different Stars
fact: Emma Watson and Miles Teller were originally cast but dropped out due to scheduling conflicts and creative differences.
behindTheScenes: Ryan Gosling was Chazelle's first choice for Sebastian, but Emma Stone wasn't considered until after Watson left the project.

title: Jazz Club Reality
fact: The jazz club "The Lighthouse" was inspired by real LA jazz clubs like The Baked Potato and Catalina Bar & Grill.
behindTheScenes: John Legend, who plays Keith, is actually a classically trained pianist who started his career playing jazz clubs.
